Sentencas: The defect chemical models with semi-empirical equilibrium constants are widely adopted to determine defect concentrations inside solid oxide materials.
Titulo: The influence of step potentials upon defect equilibria and defect concentrations inside solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, the equilibrium constants are tested under uniform atmosphere, which can not be directly applied to working fuel cells.
Titulo: The influence of step potentials upon defect equilibria and defect concentrations inside solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Step potentials are formed at the electrode/ electrolyte interfaces of working fuel cells, resulting from the completely different atmosphere between anode and cathode.
Titulo: The influence of step potentials upon defect equilibria and defect concentrations inside solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this work, the physically meaningful potential framework of working fuel cells and the strong relationship between charged defects and step potentials are established.
Titulo: The influence of step potentials upon defect equilibria and defect concentrations inside solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: One part of the Gibbs energy of electrode reactions is converted into electrical energy and stored in the step potentials.
Titulo: The influence of step potentials upon defect equilibria and defect concentrations inside solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The accurate equilibrium constants of SOFC electrode reactions are corrected by considering the step potentials.
Titulo: The influence of step potentials upon defect equilibria and defect concentrations inside solid oxide fuel cells
